taxonomicnotes: Etroplus canarensis was described by Day (1865) from South Canara (currently Karnataka, India).
rationale: Etroplus canarensis has been assessed as Endangered because of its restricted distribution to two locations, with an extent of occurrence (EOO) of less than 5,000 km² and an area of occupancy (AOO) of less than 500 km². There is also an going decline in habitat quality as a result of pollution and sand mining, and the threat of over-collection for the pet trade.
evaluator: Rema Devi, K.R., Dahanukar, N., Raghavan, R. & Molur, S.
